summary: James P. Kelly was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports from 1977 and 1978. These documents list his name, position, and salary during the specified accounting periods. The documents indicate his continued employment with the HSCA during the period covered by the reports.
significance: James P. Kelly's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, an organization tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents do not specify his role within the committee, his presence on payroll and certification reports indicates he was part of the staff involved in the investigation.
